ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC FSLIST  FILEREF=file-specification|UNIT=nn <option(s)>;
  
The FSLIST procedure enables you to browse external files that are not SAS data sets within a SAS session.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: FILEREF=file-specification] 
      
Specifies the external file to browse or a fileref that has been previously assigned 
to the external file.

[Syntax: UNIT=nn] 
      
Defines the FORTRAN-style logical unit number of the external file to browse.
Converts search strings into uppercase unless they are enclosed in quotation marks.

Does not perform a translation; the FIND command locates only those text strings 
that exactly match the search string. This is the default.
Uses the native carriage-control characters of the operating environment.
Indicates the default horizontal scroll amount for the LEFT and RIGHT commands.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Sets the default scroll amount to n columns. Replace <n> with an integer value.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Sets the default scroll amount to half the window width.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Sets the default scroll amount to the full window width.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata: Treats carriage-control characters as regular text.
Suppresses the sides and bottom of the FSLIST window's border.
Displays line sequence numbers in files that have a record length of 80 and contain sequence numbers in columns 73 through 80.
Suppresses line sequence numbers in files that have a record length of 80 and contain sequence numbers in columns 73 through 80.
Causes the procedure to honor the overprint code and print the current line over the previous line when the code is encountered.
Causes the procedure to ignore the overprint code and print each line from the file on a separate line of the display. This is the default.
